comments.content: Lack of net neutrality will not improve performance for anyone, it will just let ISPs create artificial "slow lanes" in order to extort money from companies like netflix that rely on them. This is already happening.

The thing with losing net neutrality is that once you say "XYZ service is taking up too much of our bandwidth, let's prioritize service" you are by definition censoring material and making a choice for all of your subscribers to "guide them" (by incent ... See More

I am in favor of net neutrality as it was up until now. The supposed advantage of the pay to play regime is whole new levels of technological gee-wizardry - like better real-time streaming, medical internet apps and as yet-undreamed of stuff you could do if ONLY you could charge the sheeple more for "fast" internet.

Two of your examples aren't currently considered net neutrality issues. You're right that people can pay more for faster Internet, but that's still considered neutral. Giving different speeds to different parts of the Internet, based on whether Netflix ... See More
I am not neutral about it at all. It was Sandra Bullock's worst movie ever! Ever! ...... Oh..... You're not talking about....... So I'm...... Yeah. ... See More
Bryce   &  David   - you're right: I hadn't heard the reality through the hype. Thanks!!  Chrissy   - but you're not wrong.....
Oh. I know I'm not wrong. At least not about that.  😲 😵 🙅

Given that Netflix accounts for 33% of Internet traffic, it seems reasonable that the carriers want more money from them. Especially the carriers who are middle men between the pipes that Netflix pays for directly and those the user pays. However, with ... See More

Yes, but when it comes to my home connection, Netflix didn't use 33%. I used 33% to watch Netflix. The idea that the services I'm trying to use have to pay my ISP to deliver me the content I request (at the best possible speed for the connection I paid for) is very disturbing and unintuitive for me.

I don't pay my ISP to watch netflix. I pay my ISP to give me an internet connection. Every single argument they have for a premium internet boils down to that they simply want more profits on top of an already extremely profitable business model. There is no technical justification for it. It is greed pure and simple.

Ryan, it is not reasonable that ISP's should make Netflix pay more to work correctly because it is popular. It is JUSTIFIABLE, as in, they can use that argument in order to sell you their crap idea, but it is not reasonable. We, the American people, ha ... See More

I don't support removing NN, I just wanted to give each side. UDP streaming 1) requires a lot of bandwidth, and 2) must be delivered in a timely manner to be useful. ISPs say that affects QoS for other services. Whether or not it is reasonable or justifiable is opinion I suppose.
http://youtu.be/NAxMyTwmu_M
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HAo5GgaJmsA

description: Donnelly West So... Is net neutrality 1) feasible (more reliable services tend to follow the wealthy like vultures follow a dying antelope) 2) already a fallacy (you can currently pay for "faster" service) or 3) practical (I would rather have Netflix users stream more slowly than have SOS signals to coast guards stream slowly - there ARE priorities for internet usage )? Tell me Facebook friends - especially computery folk :  David  ,  Ben  ,  Bryce  ,  Ryan  ,  John R.  ... Bryce David Chrissy

description: Ryan Van Gerena  is with  Nick Neitzel  and  17 others . WE DID IT!!!! Finally....haha.  After a day of rest and recovery we wanted to thank you all and there are so many people to thank. If I forget anyone it is not on purpose, we appreciate each and every one of you. Here goes.  Thank you Al and Sally Brown for bringing the love of my life into this world and helping us host this amazing event. It was an incredible experience. To Carol van Gerena and Hector Van Gerena for hosting our beautiful rehearsal dinner, and for making our awesome wedding cakes. thanks to Austin van Gerena for being the best Best man ever, and writing a speech so funny it made cry laughing at it so hard. Thanks to Justin Talley for doing a fantastic job at performing our ceremony, and writing such great jokes HAHA, by the way I think Justin was the most nervous out of all of us. Love ya buddy. Thank you Sean VanGerena, Densi van Gerena, Rob Neal, Kase Reeder, Tyler Murphy, and Alf Brown for standing with me and having my back. Thanks to Erika Ashley for Being the Maid of Honor, for Christine DeCoste, Nicole York, Nicole Donato, Jessica Nieters-Verhoff, Emilee Brown, and Sara Black for takin care of my girl! Thanks to Gwen Brown for coming all the way from West Vriginia. To Charlie and Denise Brown, and  Meg Beck , David Beck,  Stewart Brown , Uncle Stewart Brown, Barb Brown,  and Sandra Monaghan for coming from Colorado to see us. Kate Brown, Lis Warren,  Ron J. Hall ,  Bryan Hamilton ,  Priscilla Parchia , and Katie Meinholdt for coming out from California. Big Thanks to  Zach B. ,  Bethany Julka , and Aaron Verhoff for helping get the Dogs to and from the wedding.  Thanks to  James Jay , and  Ian Anderson  for taking one for the team and working a very long day and enabling the rest of the Uptown Clan  Eric Chandler ,  Carrie Albrecht , Jeff  Jeffrey Seiler ,  Aly Jay , and  Adam Settimo  to Attend (Adam you looked sharp, but I looked Sharper) Thanks to  Megan Anderson  A.K.A. Megatron for recognizing the Quartet was Playing Big Poppa as I walked down the Isle, and  John R. Meyer  for joining us. Thank you  Erinn Anderson  for rockin a Dragons Egg Necklace and embracing our Dorkitude! Thank you  The R2 Studio  for helping keep us on track and comfortable.  Being so professional yet personable, and taking some AMAZING PHOTOS that even make me look good!  AND for making us do the Pics at Sunset.  Thanks to  Cindy Stewart Binkley , and the  Slugs From Space  for playing such lovely music and for learning Big Poppa, you ladies did a GREAT JOB!!!  Thanks to the Arizona Snowbowl Staff for taking care of all our guest. Thank you for Karla Reyes, and Erin Olorenshaw for making it from Orlando and Vancouver respectively, and for loving and putting up with my crazy brothers.  Thank you Angela  A-super Cooper  for making it down to see us, we love your face, and YOUR MOM.  To  Chris Greenough  for bringing some Texas flavor to the festivities.  To  Ali Goral , and  John Goral  for sharing the day with us.  To Mark and Betty Crane for closing the office so all the girls could celebrate with Liz.   Bert Montoya , and Shawn Montoya for leaving the girls at home and making memories with us.     To Barbara Peterson, and Sharon Furtado for visiting from Seattle and Boston respectively, it was great meeting you ladies. Thanks to Jeremy from Ray the D.J. for keepin the party rocking.  And for Heather Phalan for making our His and Her flask. Thanks to Jeff Seiler for helping us with the center pieces they looked great!  Thanks Matt Roedig, Jennifer Vo, and Korey Heiser for joining us.  Thanks  Nick Neitzel  for giving us a much needed date night!  Thank you to everyone who made it down from Wisconsin, celebrated with us, and gave us Squeeky Cheese.  Thank you Aunt  Helen Waters  for the lovely card.  Thank you uncle Steve and Aunt Wanda Palcios for coming up, and spending time with the family it has been great seeing you again.  Thank you Aunt Sandy Spikes, you looked beautiful!  Thank you to all the crazy visitors from Colorado Springs, you guy know how to party.  Thank you  Erika French , and Ryan French for taking time from being with beautiful Kyla in order to spend the day with us, it meant more than you know.   Debbie Frazier , and Kim Nichol it was awesome seeing you both again.  Joe  Joseph Fishwick ,  Clint Medas , Doug  Douglas Martin , and  Nbc Trainers  for making it out from New England to celebrate with us,  Great to get together again boys.  Panthers for Life!!!  Susan Diumenti, Michelle Howe, Brandy and Andrew Cross, we are so glad you made it.  Thank you Greg and Marion Hermie, and Keith and Barbara Knapp.   Ho'o Kalehuawehe  for being so sweet and lovable.  Craig and Irene Larimer thank you for the night out in Berlin.  Scotty and Gretchen long thanks for partying with us.  Ray and Raeanne Munoz great to see you again thank you.   Brian Patrick James Marion  A.K.A. Goat A.K.A. Padio Gansta......I got two words for ya!!!  Thank you  Jenna Oldre , and Bryan Metz for coming up to get down with us.  Thanks Angelia A.K.A. RED HOT WONDER, (I'm still better than you at Chess.)  Thanks Jodie and Fred Ritchie.  I think That is everyone if I missed you at the wedding I wish I could have spoke to you all longer, it was a hectic eveing but we did our best.  The nite would not have been special without you all being there, and we could not have done it without you.  We love you all!!! and to the extended Uptown Family,  Sheldon Jr Whitebird ,  Chad Lundberg ,  Marlene Larson ,  Amy Rhodes ,  Joe Connell ,  Leslie Connell ,  Bob Larkin , Doug Litner, Matt  Matthew Banks ,  Cole Lupton ,  Chelsea Taylor ,  Shelley Buckman ,  Tobby Moran ,  Kendrick Daw , Dawn Moran Jimmy Woods ,  Jeff Touchette , James Hoffman, Dave Dennehey and so, so, many others we really wanted to set up a nite at Uptown with all of you and get together and celebrate with you as well. However things were just so busy this week and we were not able to pull it off.  I will see you all on the Flip Side.  Cheers!!! Jimmy Woods Jeff Touchette James Hoffman Aaron Verhoff Mikee Feral

description: Monica Multiple  shared  Revolution News 's  video . I feel helpless about the condition of the country I was born in. A moment before I watched this video i spoke with my friend,  John R. Meyer  about the differences between cops in Indonesia and in the states. My example was:   In the states, I was hitchhiking and I cop stopped to talk to me. I told him I had been robbed a month before in Honduras and couldn't afford a train home. He gave me a ticket for $200.   In Indonesia, I was hitchhiking and told an officer I didn't have much money but wanted to travel Indonesia. He took me out to dinner and to sight see around his hometown, then after arguing about it for about five minutes I accepted 210,000 rupiahs from him (about $20, and that's a lot here) so I could get a bus (if I wanted), and he let me stay on his couch and gave me a ride in the morning.   I wish I knew something better I could do other than just live in countries with politics I can agree with more... Any suggestions? This is a sad day for the US. Blanka Bartosova

description: John Tannous  is with  John R. Meyer  and  11 others . It’s Halloween weekend, so surely I’m going to lead with spooky events and costume parties and the like. After all, what’s more fun than the large number of presidential candidate costumes that show up during election season? I can’t wait to see how many  Michael Dukakis  costumes there are!  But, seriously, this weekend is actually all about live music. We have so many great live shows for you that you could forget all about the orange and black festival of candy for kids and weird parties for adults. It begins at the Orpheum Theater which has two acts in two nights:  Greensky Bluegrass  Wednesday night, and  Nahko and Medicine for the People  Thursday night.   Flagstaff Sings  is a new choral group in town. Their premier concert is this Friday night at CCA, and it won’t be your typical choral concert, as they will have a live band and play everything from rock music to jazz to gospel, and everything in between. The  Cadillac Angels  will be rockin’  The Museum Club  also on Friday night. On Saturday,  Orchestra Northern Arizona  is playing their  Chronological Concert , and it’s free to attend. And, if you want to ignore Halloween altogether, catch the Horizon Concert Series on October 31, featuring pianist  Jeffrey Swann .  Halloween lovers, don’t fret, though. Music may be the headline, but spooky events are everywhere in Flagstaff this weekend. The can’t-miss event of All Hallow’s Eve has to be Circus Bacchus’  A Nightmare on Aspen Street 3 at Orpheum Theater – Flagstaff  on Saturday night.  Canyon Movement Company  is showing their annual  See, Hear, Speak no evil: dances for Halloween  on Friday and Saturday night. The popular  Stories to Life: Stranger Things Have Happened  is on Sunday. Plus, there’s the  The Rocky Horror Picture Show  (maybe you’ve heard of it?), the showing of local film Bloody Border's Halloween Season Showing $5, and dozens of other Halloween events for kids and adults alike.  Please add your events below because I can't get to them all. And check out Flagstaff 365 for more.  So, get out there and support live music, local musicians, and local artists. Go have fun and celebrate being in this incredible town. Happy Halloween, Flagstaff! Riordan Action Network

comments.content: I'm so glad you're here and a part of my family!!

I love to tell people that I ran off and joined the circus! And I get so excited anytime someone requests me to spin fire, I miss doing it on the reg in a " organized" manner, but I just love the costumes, comradery, and being a part of something that is so fun for me and everyone watching

I love that when people here (in Iowa) ask what I did back home. That I get to say I was a teacher by day and circus performer at night. The friends I will always have and the wonderful memories, that all of you have given me have been amazing! I love and miss playing with you guys!
I happy I am a part of those memories. They are very close to me and will chair-ish them always  😁 ❤️
